creator: sburugula@sengen.com
text:
When a custom tag is placed inside a block for the first time it's used in a 
jsp file and the same tag is used with a similar signature outside the block we 
get either a null pointer exception or scope resolution problem.
   The cause for this problem is that when the jsp engine sees a tag for the 
first time,it initializes the tag class by allocating memory.The same memory is 
used through out the page whenever the same tag with the same signature is 
used.So,if you try to put the first occurrence in a block,the memory is not 
allocated and hence you get a null pointer problem when you try to access it 
outside the block.
  There should be some way of fixing it by modifying the jsp engine code..The 
memory should be allocated whenever the tag class is used.This is a serious 
problem that i find many times.

creator: marc.saegesser@apropos.com
text:
I talked with the bug submitter and it turns out that he's using a different 
application server, not Tomcat.  Tomcat does not suffer from this problem.
